channel.title: Wired's Gadget Lab Podcast
channel.description: Listen in every week as the Wired product team waxes poetic about the gadget news of the past few days. It may not change your life, but you'll hear our take on a range of products, from the latest laptop computers to the hottest geek toys on the planet. Laugh. Cry. Learn. Love. Just tune in. We'll do the rest.
channel.itunes:subtitle: This week at Gadget Lab
channel.itunes:author: Wired
channel.itunes:summary: Listen in every week as the Wired product team waxes poetic about the gadget news of the past few days. It may not change your life, but you'll hear our take on a range of products, from the latest laptop computers to the hottest geek toys on the planet. Laugh. Cry. Learn. Love. Just tune in. We'll do the rest.

item.title: Wired Gadget Lab Podcast #045
item.itunes:author: Dylan Tweney
item.itunes:subtitle: Zune vs. iPod, Sony's A900 camera, and new HDTVs
item.itunes:summary: The Gadget Lab crew talk about Microsoft's new Zunes and how they stack up against Apple's new iPods. Plus: Sony's new digital SLR camera, the Alpha 900, and highlights from the upcoming crop of TVs. With Dylan Tweney, Jose Fermoso and Brian Chen.
item.itunes:keywords: Microsoft, Zune, Apple, iPod, nano, Sony, Alpha 900, A900, TV, HDTV, CEDIA, Wired, Wired.com, Gadget Lab
item.description: The Gadget Lab crew talk about Microsoft's new Zunes and how they stack up against Apple's new iPods. Plus: Sony's new digital SLR camera, the Alpha 900, and highlights from the upcoming crop of TVs. With Dylan Tweney, Jose Fermoso and Brian Chen.

item.title: Wired Gadget Lab Podcast #044
item.itunes:author: Dylan Tweney
item.itunes:subtitle: Tivo HD XL, Peek, and iPhone 3G
item.itunes:summary: The new, 1-terabyte Tivo HD XL, the Peek email device, and iPhone 3G problems continue as someone files suit against Apple and AT&T. Plus: Apple has a special event planned for Sept. 9, and we expect it to include a new, widescreen Nano.
item.itunes:keywords: Wired, Wired.com, Tivo, Peek, iPhone, Apple, AT&T
item.description: The new, 1-terabyte Tivo HD XL, the Peek email device, and iPhone 3G problems continue as someone files suit against Apple and AT&T. Plus: Apple has a special event planned for Sept. 9, and we expect it to include a new, widescreen Nano.

item.title: Wired Gadget Lab Podcast #043
item.itunes:author: Dylan Tweney
item.itunes:subtitle: Nikon D90, Palm Treo Pro, and iPhone Girl
item.itunes:summary: The Gadget Lab crew discusses the Nikon D90 SLR camera (which now has the ability to record high-definition video), the Palm Treo Pro, and the results of Wired.com's iPhone 3G data connectivity survey. Plus: iPhone Girl!
item.itunes:keywords: Wired, Wired.com, Gadget Lab, Nikon, D90, camera, SLR, Palm, Treo, Treo Pro, iPhone, Apple, 3G, iPhone Girl, iPhone 3G
item.description: The Gadget Lab crew discusses the Nikon D90 SLR camera (which now has the ability to record high-definition video), the Palm Treo Pro, and the results of Wired.com's iPhone 3G data connectivity survey. Plus: iPhone Girl!

item.title: Wired Gadget Lab Podcast #042
item.itunes:author: Dylan Tweney
item.itunes:subtitle: Palm Treo Pro, iPhone 3G Problems, Lenovo Ideapad U110
item.itunes:summary: The Gadget Lab crew discusses the Palm Treo Pro (and Palm's future), the iPhone's 3G network problems, the Lenovo Ideapad U110, and what operating systems Wired people use. This episode features Dylan Tweney, Jose Fermoso and Brian Chen.
item.itunes:keywords: Wired, wired.com, Palm, Treo, Treo Pro, iPhone, 3G, Lenovo, Ideapad, U110, Apple, Mac, OS X, Linux
item.description: The Gadget Lab crew discusses the Palm Treo Pro (and Palm's future), the iPhone's 3G network problems, the Lenovo Ideapad U110, and what operating systems Wired people use. This episode features Dylan Tweney, Jose Fermoso and Brian Chen.

item.title: Wired Gadget Lab Podcast #041
item.itunes:author: Dylan Tweney
item.itunes:subtitle: Micro Four Thirds, micro houses, MSI Wind, Eee Box PC.
item.itunes:summary: The Gadgeteers discuss the new Micro Four Thirds standard for SLR-quality point-and-shoot cameras, micro-sized houses on wheels, the new MSI Wind mini-notebook, and the Eee Box tabletop PC.
item.itunes:keywords: Wired, Wired.com, Wired Magazine, Gadget Lab, Olympus, Panasonic, MSI, Wind, Asus, Eee PC, Eee Box, Micro Four Thirds, Four Thirds
item.description: The Gadgeteers discuss the new Micro Four Thirds standard for SLR-quality point-and-shoot cameras, micro-sized houses on wheels, the new MSI Wind mini-notebook, and the Eee Box tabletop PC.

item.title: Wired Gadget Lab Podcast #040
item.itunes:author: Dylan Tweney
item.itunes:subtitle: T-Mobile Sidekick, Nokia E71, WinePod
item.itunes:summary: Wired.com's Gadget Lab editors review the latest, 2008 edition of the T-Mobile Sidekick, Nokia's iPhone-killing E71, and take a first look at the home vintner's dream, the WinePod. Plus: Wakin' to bacon!
item.itunes:keywords: Wired, wired.com, gadget lab, gadget, t-mobile, sidekick, nokia, e71, iphone, WinePod, wine
item.description: Wired.com's Gadget Lab editors review the latest, 2008 edition of the T-Mobile Sidekick, Nokia's iPhone-killing E71, and take a first look at the home vintner's dream, the WinePod. Plus: Wakin' to bacon!

item.title: Wired Gadget Lab Podcast #039
item.itunes:author: Dylan Tweney
item.itunes:subtitle: Nokia's platform efforts, Dr Dre's headphones, and an anti-theft stun gun for bikes.
item.itunes:summary: Wired.com editors Dylan Tweney, Danny Dumas and Jose Fermoso discuss Nokia's efforts to create a standard platform for mobile phones -- which, we hope, may kick of an era of innovation and interoperability instead of the mess we have today. Plus: a preview of Monster Cable's Dr. Dre-branded "Beat" headphones, and a very shocking anti-theft device for bicycles.
item.itunes:keywords: Wired, wired.com, Dre, Monster Cable, Nokia, Symbian, bike, bicycle
item.description: Wired.com editors Dylan Tweney, Danny Dumas and Jose Fermoso discuss Nokia's efforts to create a standard platform for mobile phones -- which, we hope, may kick of an era of innovation and interoperability instead of the mess we have today. Plus: a preview of Monster Cable's Dr. Dre-branded "Beat" headphones, and a very shocking anti-theft device for bicycles.

item.title: Wired Gadget Lab Podcast #038
item.itunes:author: Dylan Tweney
item.itunes:subtitle: Atomic watches, the HP MiniNote, and problems with the iPhone 3G launch
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, the Gadget Lab gang review four self-synchronizing atomic watches, and run through the features of HP's much-anticipated mini notebook, the HP MiniNote. Plus: Problems abound with the launch of the iPhone 3G and the iPhone 2.0 operating system. Is Apple losing its touch?
item.itunes:keywords: Casio, Oceanus, Citizen, watches, Hewlett-Packard, HP, mininote, notebook, Apple, iPhone, 3G
item.description: In this episode, the Gadget Lab gang review four self-synchronizing atomic watches, and run through the features of HP's much-anticipated mini notebook, the HP MiniNote. Plus: Problems abound with the launch of the iPhone 3G and the iPhone 2.0 operating system. Is Apple losing its touch?

item.title: Wired's Gadget Lab Podcast #37
item.itunes:author: Dylan Tweney
item.itunes:subtitle: iPhone 3G, OpenMoko Neo Freerunner, and the GammaTech Durabook
item.itunes:summary: The hot topics in this week's podcast are the iPhone 3G launch (including the new iPhone 2.0 OS), OpenMoko's Neo Freerunner (a Linux-based, totally open source smartphone), and the rugged GammaTech Durabook.
item.itunes:keywords: iPhone, Apple, OpenMoko, Neo, Freerunner, open source, Linux, GammaTech, Durabook, 3G, 2.0
item.description: The hot topics in this week's podcast are the iPhone 3G launch (including the new iPhone 2.0 OS), OpenMoko's Neo Freerunner (a Linux-based, totally open source smartphone), and the rugged GammaTech Durabook.

item.title: Wired Gadget Lab Podcast #036
item.itunes:author: Dylan Tweney
item.itunes:subtitle: Wired's summer gadget reviews, JVC Everio GZ-HD40, and the Asus U2E ultralight laptop.
item.itunes:summary: The new Summer Test site from Wired.com has more than 50 new product reviews. Plus: A first look at the JVC Everio GZ-HD40 camcorder, a review of the Asus U2E ultralight laptop, and the future of ultralight notebooks.
item.description: The new Summer Test site from Wired.com has more than 50 new product reviews. Plus: A first look at the JVC Everio GZ-HD40 camcorder, a review of the Asus U2E ultralight laptop, and the future of ultralight notebooks.

item.title: Wired Gadget Lab Podcast #035
item.itunes:author: Dylan Tweney
item.itunes:subtitle: True 3-D display, camera gun graffiti, and the Sony Ericsson W350 Walkman phone.
item.itunes:summary: Wired.com's Dylan Tweney and Jose Fermoso discuss a new fully 3-D display, a "camera gun" that secretly inserts visual graffiti into unsuspecting tourist's photos, and the new Sony Ericsson W350 Walkman phone. Plus, we talk about a controller for Guitar Hero on the Wii, and the new Rock Band for the Wii.
item.itunes:keywords: display, Walkman, Sony, Sony Ericsson, phone, camera, 3-D, 3D, Guitar Hero, Rock Band, Wii
item.description: Wired.com's Dylan Tweney and Jose Fermoso discuss a new fully 3-D display, a "camera gun" that secretly inserts visual graffiti into unsuspecting tourist's photos, and the new Sony Ericsson W350 Walkman phone. Plus, we talk about a controller for Guitar Hero on the Wii, and the new Rock Band for the Wii.

item.title: Wired Gadget Lab Podcast #034
item.itunes:author: Dylan Tweney
item.itunes:subtitle: Toshiba Portege R500, Samsung Instinct, and Nikon D60 SLR camera.
item.itunes:summary: Wired's Gadget Lab crew reviews the latest gadgets: Toshiba's slim Portege R500 notebook (now with a 128GB solid-state drive), Samsung's "iPhone killer" Instinct, and Nikon's mighty D60 SLR camera.
item.itunes:keywords: Toshiba, Portege, Samsung, Instinct, Nikon, SLR, camera, notebook, smartphone, iPhone
item.description: Wired's Gadget Lab crew reviews the latest gadgets: Toshiba's slim Portege R500 notebook (now with a 128GB solid-state drive), Samsung's "iPhone killer" Instinct, and Nikon's mighty D60 SLR camera.

item.title: Wired Gadget Lab Podcast #033
item.itunes:author: Dylan Tweney
item.itunes:subtitle: Apple's iPhone 3G launches July 11; Polaroid's PoGo printer; a first-person RC video car; and the Flip Mino
item.itunes:summary: Wired's tech editors chat about the iPhone 3G's impending launch on July 11, and what to expect when you get to the store. Plus, we review a remote-control car that includes a wireless video camera and remote goggles, so you get a first-person view from the driver's seat, and the Polaroid PoGo Printer.
item.itunes:keywords: Apple Mac iPhone AT&T RC car Polaroid printer PoGo Fat Shark
item.description: Wired's tech editors chat about the iPhone 3G's impending launch on July 11, and what to expect when you get to the store. Plus, we review a remote-control car that includes a wireless video camera and remote goggles, so you get a first-person view from the driver's seat, and the Polaroid PoGo Printer.

item.title: Wired Gadget Lab Podcast #032
item.itunes:author: Dylan Tweney
item.itunes:subtitle: Low-cost mini-notebooks, Eye-Fi, high-tech swimsuits and a $2,000, 52-inch TV.
item.itunes:summary: Wired's Gadget Lab crew tackles the new crop of low-cost mini-notebooks, an Eye-Fi card that helped catch a camera thief, high-tech swimsuits for the Olympics, and a 52-inch LCD TV from Westinghouse that costs less than $2,000.
item.itunes:keywords: notebook, eye-fi, swimsuit, Olympics, TV, HDTV, Westinghouse, Speedo, computer, ultraportable
item.description: Wired's Gadget Lab crew tackles the new crop of low-cost mini-notebooks, an Eye-Fi card that helped catch a camera thief, high-tech swimsuits for the Olympics, and a 52-inch LCD TV from Westinghouse that costs less than $2,000.

item.title: Wired Gadget Lab Podcast #031
item.itunes:author: Dylan Tweney
item.itunes:subtitle: Dell's mini-notebook, Nokia N96, Garmin Edge 705, and Puget Systems.
item.itunes:summary: The Gadget Lab crew talk about the hottest topics in gadgets this week. Dell's forthcoming mini-notebook: It's red! And that's about all we know about that. Plus, Nokia's N96 is coming to the U.S. later this year, and may have an unbelievable price tag. Plus, reviews of the bike-mounted Garmin Edge 705 GPS and a super-high end gaming PC from Puget Systems.
item.itunes:keywords: Dell, Nokia, Garmin, Puget Systems, GPS, gaming, mini-notebook, ultramobile PC, UMPC
item.description: The Gadget Lab crew talk about the hottest topics in gadgets this week. Dell's forthcoming mini-notebook: It's red! And that's about all we know about that. Plus, Nokia's N96 is coming to the U.S. later this year, and may have an unbelievable price tag. Plus, reviews of the bike-mounted Garmin Edge 705 GPS and a super-high end gaming PC from Puget Systems.

item.title: Wired Gadget Lab Podcast #030
item.itunes:author: Dylan Tweney
item.itunes:subtitle: Second-generation OLCP, iPhone 2.0 details, Asus' 1-TB laptop, and the Roku Netflix box.
item.itunes:summary: The Gadget Lab staff talk about Nicholas Negroponte's sneak preview of the second-generation XO laptop from his One Laptop Per Child project. Plus: More details on the iPhone 2.0 launch. And we review a 1-terabyte laptop from Asus, the M70 (it's a monster), and the Roku Netflix box, which streams movies from the popular DVD rental service.
item.itunes:keywords: OLCP XO iPhone Asus Roku Netflix
item.description: The Gadget Lab staff talk about Nicholas Negroponte's sneak preview of the second-generation XO laptop from his One Laptop Per Child project. Plus: More details on the iPhone 2.0 launch. And we review a 1-terabyte laptop from Asus, the M70 (it's a monster), and the Roku Netflix box, which streams movies from the popular DVD rental service.

item.title: Wired Gadget Lab Podcast #029
item.itunes:author: Dylan Tweney
item.itunes:subtitle: What you need to know about iPhone 2.0, the Jawbone 2, EeePC 900, and the Flip 2.
item.itunes:summary:
The Gadget Lab crew discusses everything we know about iPhone 2.0, the widely-anticipated and probably 3G-compatible sequel to Apple's popular smartphone. Plus: reviews of the now lighter and skinnier Jawbone 2 Bluetooth headset, Asus's Eee PC 900, and the HP Mini-Note. Finally, we evaluate the easy-to-use, inexpensive video camera, the Flip 2.
Appearing in this episode: Wired.com associate reviews editor Danny Dumas, multimedia editor Annaliza Savage, and senior editor Dylan Tweney.
item.itunes:keywords: Apple iPhone Aliph Jawbone EeePC Flip video HP Mini-Note
item.description:
The Gadget Lab crew discusses everything we know about iPhone 2.0, the widely-anticipated and probably 3G-compatible sequel to Apple's popular smartphone. Plus: reviews of the now lighter and skinnier Jawbone 2 Bluetooth headset, Asus's Eee PC 900, and the HP Mini-Note. Finally, we evaluate the easy-to-use, inexpensive video camera, the Flip 2.
Appearing in this episode: Wired.com associate reviews editor Danny Dumas, multimedia editor Annaliza Savage, and senior editor Dylan Tweney.

item.title: Wired Gadget Lab Podcast #028
item.itunes:author: Dylan Tweney
item.itunes:subtitle: Maker Faire, Samsung Glyde, and the Olympus E-420 SLR.
item.itunes:summary: Dylan Tweney, Danny Dumas and Wired.com multimedia editor Annaliza Savage talk about the Maker Faire and Wired.com's recent reviews of the Samsung Glyde (a slider phone with an awesome extra feature for concertgoers) and the Olympus E-420 (the smallest digital SLR camera we've seen yet).
item.itunes:keywords: Maker Faire, Samsung, Olympus, camera, phone, SLR, Wired, Wired.com
item.description: Dylan Tweney, Danny Dumas and Wired.com multimedia editor Annaliza Savage talk about the Maker Faire and Wired.com's recent reviews of the Samsung Glyde (a slider phone with an awesome extra feature for concertgoers) and the Olympus E-420 (the smallest digital SLR camera we've seen yet).

item.title: Wired Gadget Lab Podcast #027
item.itunes:author: Dylan Tweney
item.itunes:subtitle: Psystar, T-Mobile 3-G, AT&T TV, and more.
item.itunes:summary: The latest news on would-be Mac clone maker Psystar, T-Mobile's new voice-only 3-G service (no fast data support -- wtf?), and AT&T's new TV service. Plus reviews of the LG enV2 and Motorola Z9 phones.
item.itunes:keywords: Psystar, T-Mobile, AT&T, Motorola, LG, 3-G, 3G, Maker Faire
item.description: The latest news on would-be Mac clone maker Psystar, T-Mobile's new voice-only 3-G service (no fast data support -- wtf?), and AT&T's new TV service. Plus reviews of the LG enV2 and Motorola Z9 phones.

item.title: Wired Gadget Lab Podcast #026
item.itunes:author: Dylan Tweney
item.itunes:subtitle: Asus' Eee PC, the Optimus Maximus keyboard, an awesome iPod dock, and a huge, expensive watch.
item.itunes:summary: The Gadget Lab crew discusses the new version of the Asus Eee PC -- now with a 9-inch LCD, and a special extra-high-capacity battery for reviewers -- and the Optimus Maximus keyboard, which is finally available. We review the Kicker iK500 iPod Dock, the Tissot T-Touch Watch, and the Nokia N95 8GB smartphone. And we talk about why your shoes are wrecking your feet.
item.itunes:keywords: Asus EeePC Optimus Maximus iPod Tissot Nokia N95
item.description: The Gadget Lab crew discusses the new version of the Asus Eee PC -- now with a 9-inch LCD, and a special extra-high-capacity battery for reviewers -- and the Optimus Maximus keyboard, which is finally available. We review the Kicker iK500 iPod Dock, the Tissot T-Touch Watch, and the Nokia N95 8GB smartphone. And we talk about why your shoes are wrecking your feet.

item.title: Wired Gadget Lab Podcast #025
item.itunes:author: Dylan Tweney
item.itunes:subtitle: Mac clone maker Psystar, reviews of the Olympus SP-570UZ and a Sharp LCD, and a 9-inch Asus Eee.
item.itunes:summary: The Gadget Lab crew talks about mysterious Mac clone-maker Psystar, reviews the 10-megapixel Olympus SP-570UZ and re-reviews a 46-inch Sharp LCD TV, and talks about the upcoming Asus Eee PC 900, a cheap ultraportable with a 9-inch screen. Plus: Rumors of a 24-megapixel Nikon!
item.itunes:keywords: Olympus Nikon Asus Eee Sharp Psystar Mac clone
item.description: The Gadget Lab crew talks about mysterious Mac clone-maker Psystar, reviews the 10-megapixel Olympus SP-570UZ and re-reviews a 46-inch Sharp LCD TV, and talks about the upcoming Asus Eee PC 900, a cheap ultraportable with a 9-inch screen. Plus: Rumors of a 24-megapixel Nikon!

item.title: Wired Gadget Lab Podcast #024
item.itunes:author: Dylan Tweney
item.itunes:subtitle: The coming iPhone 2.0, Everex MyMini PC, Mac Mini, and Pacemaker Portable DJ Machine
item.itunes:summary: The Gadget Lab crew talk about the coming iPhone 2.0 and the features we expect it to have. Plus: reviews of the Everex MyMiniPC, the Apple Mac Mini, and the Pacemaker Portable DJ Machine.
item.itunes:keywords: apple mac mini everex mymini pc pacemaker dj linux ubuntu 3G
item.description: The Gadget Lab crew talk about the coming iPhone 2.0 and the features we expect it to have. Plus: reviews of the Everex MyMiniPC, the Apple Mac Mini, and the Pacemaker Portable DJ Machine.

item.title: Wired Gadget Lab Podcast #023
item.itunes:author: Dylan Tweney
item.itunes:subtitle: The latest cellphone news from CTIA, 5 megapixel camera phones, and more.
item.itunes:summary: The Gadget Lab crew discuss the latest cellphone news from CTIA Wireless 2008, including 5 megapixel cameraphones, iPhone clones, and more. Plus: A gold iPod for David Beckham!
item.itunes:keywords: CTIA wireless cellphone cameraphone megapixel Samsung LG iPhone
item.description: The Gadget Lab crew discuss the latest cellphone news from CTIA Wireless 2008, including 5 megapixel cameraphones, iPhone clones, and more. Plus: A gold iPod for David Beckham!

item.title: Wired Gadget Lab Podcast #022
item.itunes:author: Dylan Tweney
item.itunes:subtitle: Motorola breaks up, Sony drops a $50 anti-bloatware fee, and we review an Apple tablet.
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, we tackle the breakup of Motorola, Sony's quick about-face on a $50 fee to remove useless "bloatware" from its notebooks, and we review the Axiotron Modbook (a Macbook tablet!) and the Olympus LS-10 voice recorder.
item.itunes:keywords: motorola apple axiotron modbook olympus voice recorder sony bloatware
item.description: In this episode, we tackle the breakup of Motorola, Sony's quick about-face on a $50 fee to remove useless "bloatware" from its notebooks, and we review the Axiotron Modbook (a Macbook tablet!) and the Olympus LS-10 voice recorder.

item.title: Wired Gadget Lab Podcast #021
item.itunes:author: Dylan Tweney
item.itunes:subtitle: The 700MHz spectrum auction, HTC's Android phone, and the Samsung Ace.
item.itunes:summary: This week the Gadget Lab crew tackle the FCC's recently-closed spectrum auction and what it means for gadget lovers (more and better phones!). Plus we discuss the HTC Dream, an Android-based phone due later this year, and the Samsung Ace, a smartphone that just hit the market.
item.itunes:keywords: spectrum 700mhz google googlephone android HTC Samsung Ace
item.description: This week the Gadget Lab crew tackle the FCC's recently-closed spectrum auction and what it means for gadget lovers (more and better phones!). Plus we discuss the HTC Dream, an Android-based phone due later this year, and the Samsung Ace, a smartphone that just hit the market.

item.title: Wired Gadget Lab Podcast #020
item.itunes:author: Dylan Tweney
item.itunes:subtitle: Exploding batteries, the ultralight Thinkpad X300, and more.
item.itunes:summary: The Gadget Lab crew tackle the issue of exploding batteries and what -- if anything -- the electronics industry is doing about them. Plus: reviews of the Lenovo Thinkpad X300, a media center PC from Sony, and the new AT&T-compatible, GSM-based Palm Centro.
item.itunes:keywords: battery batteries lenovo thinkpad sony at&t palm cento
item.description: The Gadget Lab crew tackle the issue of exploding batteries and what -- if anything -- the electronics industry is doing about them. Plus: reviews of the Lenovo Thinkpad X300, a media center PC from Sony, and the new AT&T-compatible, GSM-based Palm Centro.

item.title: Wired Gadget Lab Podcast #019
item.itunes:author: Dylan Tweney
item.itunes:subtitle: Apple's iPhone SDK, new tech from Microsoft, and the Strida bike.
item.itunes:summary: The Gadget Lab crew discuss the biggest gadget news of the week: Apple's software development kit (SDK) for the iPhone, and a new $100 million investment fund targeting iPhone app programmers. Also, we talk about some new tech from the R&D labs of Microsoft and of Carnegie Mellon, and take a first look at the Strida folding bicycle.
item.itunes:keywords: apple iphone sdk microsoft strida bicycle bike
item.description: The Gadget Lab crew discuss the biggest gadget news of the week: Apple's software development kit (SDK) for the iPhone, and a new $100 million investment fund targeting iPhone app programmers. Also, we talk about some new tech from the R&D labs of Microsoft and of Carnegie Mellon, and take a first look at the Strida folding bicycle.

item.title: Wired Gadget Lab Podcast #018
item.itunes:author: Dylan Tweney
item.itunes:subtitle: The Nokia Morph, Chumby, and a variety of inexpensive, miniature computers.
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, the Gadget Lab crew discuss Nokia's flexible "Morph" concept phone, the DIY-friendly Chumby, Everex's $400 laptop called the Cloudbook, and mini computers like the gPC and the Mac Mini.
item.itunes:keywords: Nokia Morph phone Chumby DIY Linux Everex Cloudbook Mac Mini gPC
item.description: In this episode, the Gadget Lab crew discuss Nokia's flexible "Morph" concept phone, the DIY-friendly Chumby, Everex's $400 laptop called the Cloudbook, and mini computers like the gPC and the Mac Mini.

item.title: Wired Gadget Lab Podcast #017
item.itunes:author: Dylan Tweney
item.itunes:summary: The gadget lab crew, with special guest Bryan Gardiner, discuss the official end of HD DVD, Sharper Image filing for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection, and a new Wiimote-resistant TV Panasonic is developing. Plus, we review the SageTV HD STXHD100 Media Extender, and the Asus Nova P22 Mini PC.
item.itunes:keywords: HD-DVD Blu-ray Sharper Image Panasonic Wii SageTV Asus miniPC
item.description: The gadget lab crew, with special guest Bryan Gardiner, discuss the official end of HD DVD, Sharper Image filing for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection, and a new Wiimote-resistant TV Panasonic is developing. Plus, we review the SageTV HD STXHD100 Media Extender, and the Asus Nova P22 Mini PC.

item.title: Wired Gadget Lab Podcast #016
item.itunes:author: Dylan Tweney
item.itunes:subtitle: Wired's Gadget Lab crew tackle kids 'n' camcorders, Blu-ray, 1080p projectors, and more
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, the Gadget Lab crew discusses why you should give your kids cellphones or video cameras (hint: it has to do with an out-of-control Baltimore police officer), the triumph of Blu-ray, a roundup of (relatively) inexpensive 1080p projectors, and the return of the Nokia N-Gage -- aka the Tacophone -- in the form of Nokia's new N81.
item.itunes:keywords: Baltimore cellphone camcorder Blu-ray HD-DVD 1080p projector Nokia N-Gage N81
item.description: In this episode, the Gadget Lab crew discusses why you should give your kids cellphones or video cameras (hint: it has to do with an out-of-control Baltimore police officer), the triumph of Blu-ray, a roundup of (relatively) inexpensive 1080p projectors, and the return of the Nokia N-Gage -- aka the Tacophone -- in the form of Nokia's new N81.

item.title: Wired Gadget Lab Podcast #015
item.itunes:author: Dylan Tweney
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, the Gadget Lab crew discusses Orwell's 1984 -- does the technology described in this novel exist today? Plus: gadgets for which miniaturization is a really bad idea, and the cool gear used by network broadcasters to cover Super Tuesday (think giant multitouch screens). And we review some great audio gear including an 11.2 surround sound system from Yamaha, the THX Razer Mako desktop speakers, and the Slacker, a new internet radio device.
item.itunes:keywords: Yamaha THX Razer Mako Slacker Orwell 1984 Super Tuesday
item.description: In this episode, the Gadget Lab crew discusses Orwell's 1984 -- does the technology described in this novel exist today? Plus: gadgets for which miniaturization is a really bad idea, and the cool gear used by network broadcasters to cover Super Tuesday (think giant multitouch screens). And we review some great audio gear including an 11.2 surround sound system from Yamaha, the THX Razer Mako desktop speakers, and the Slacker, a new internet radio device.

item.title: Wired Gadget Lab Podcast #014
item.itunes:author: Dylan Tweney
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, the Gadget Lab crew discuss Garmin's upcoming GPS-centric Nuviphone, MP3 players from Samsung and Haier, and camera news from PMA 2008.
item.itunes:keywords: Garmin Nuviphone Haier Ibiza Samsung PMA camera digicam
item.description: In this episode, the Gadget Lab crew discuss Garmin's upcoming GPS-centric Nuviphone, MP3 players from Samsung and Haier, and camera news from PMA 2008.

item.title: Wired Gadget Lab Podcast #013
item.itunes:author: Dylan Tweney
item.itunes:subtitle: The MacBook Air, a new Dyson vacuum cleaner, and Nokia's E90
item.itunes:summary: In this episode of Wired's Gadget Lab podcast, we discuss highlights from Macworld 2008, including the MacBook Air, plus our reviews of the Dyson DC-24 Vacuum Cleaner, the Jura Capresso Impressa Espresso machine, and Nokia's $1100 E90 phone/internet device.
item.itunes:keywords: Apple MacBook Air Macworld Dyson Jura Nokia E90
item.description: In this episode of Wired's Gadget Lab podcast, we discuss highlights from Macworld 2008, including the MacBook Air, plus our reviews of the Dyson DC-24 Vacuum Cleaner, the Jura Capresso Impressa Espresso machine, and Nokia's $1100 E90 phone/internet device.

item.title: Wired Gadget Lab Podcast #012
item.itunes:author: Dylan Tweney
item.itunes:summary: This week, the Gadget Lab crew are coming to you from Las Vegas, where we've been covering the 2008 International Consumer Electronics Show, or CES as it's known in these parts. Wired's Dylan Tweney, Jose Fermoso and Rob Beschizza talk about the massive festival of electronic goods, and point out some of the highlights, including Alienware's prototype wrap-around monitor for gamers, Panasonic's 150-inch monster plasma TV, Pioneer's Kuro technology for producing ultra-black blacks, and more.
item.itunes:keywords: Wired Gadget Lab CES Panasonic Alienware Pioneer Kuro
item.description: This week, the Gadget Lab crew are coming to you from Las Vegas, where we've been covering the 2008 International Consumer Electronics Show, or CES as it's known in these parts. Wired's Dylan Tweney, Jose Fermoso and Rob Beschizza talk about the massive festival of electronic goods, and point out some of the highlights, including Alienware's prototype wrap-around monitor for gamers, Panasonic's 150-inch monster plasma TV, Pioneer's Kuro technology for producing ultra-black blacks, and more.

item.title: Wired Gadget Lab Podcast #011
item.itunes:author: Dylan Tweney
item.itunes:summary: The Gadget Lab crew talks about the upcoming 2008 International Consumer Electronics Show, Jan. 7-10 in Las Vegas. In this episode, we discuss some of the trends we expect to see at CES, include more wirelessness, the proliferation of touchscreens, and of course, larger and cheaper TVs. And don't miss Wired's up-to-the-minute coverage of CES at http://www.wired.com/ces
item.itunes:keywords: Wired Gadget Lab CES
item.description: The Gadget Lab crew talks about the upcoming 2008 International Consumer Electronics Show, Jan. 7-10 in Las Vegas. In this episode, we discuss some of the trends we expect to see at CES, include more wirelessness, the proliferation of touchscreens, and of course, larger and cheaper TVs. And don't miss Wired's up-to-the-minute coverage of CES at http://www.wired.com/ces

item.title: Wired Gadget Lab Podcast #010
item.itunes:author: Dylan Tweney
item.itunes:summary: This week, the Gadget Lab crew talks about last-minute gift suggestions for your gadget-loving geek friends, Toshiba's home nuclear power plant, and Wired's annual Vaporware Awards. Products covered in this podcast include the $8,000 Falcon Northwest FragBook DRX Gaming Notebook, the Pyramat Gaming Chair, Able Planet's Lost Cauze Gaming Headphones, and the Samsung BlackJack and its missing Windows Mobile 6 upgrade. Plus: A T-shirt that shows Wi-Fi signal strength!
item.itunes:keywords: gadget gadgets pyramat wi-fi samsung blackjack vaporware wired
item.description: This week, the Gadget Lab crew talks about last-minute gift suggestions for your gadget-loving geek friends, Toshiba's home nuclear power plant, and Wired's annual Vaporware Awards. Products covered in this podcast include the $8,000 Falcon Northwest FragBook DRX Gaming Notebook, the Pyramat Gaming Chair, Able Planet's Lost Cauze Gaming Headphones, and the Samsung BlackJack and its missing Windows Mobile 6 upgrade. Plus: A T-shirt that shows Wi-Fi signal strength!

item.title: Wired Gadget Lab Podcast #009
item.itunes:author: Dylan Tweney
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, we discuss Sega's plans to make mind-controlled toys using technology from NeuroSky. We compare three laptops for less than $500 -- the One Laptop Per Child XO PC (aka the "$100 laptop"), the Asus Eee, and the Zonbu. Wired helps you decide whether you should buy the iPod Classic or the Microsoft Zune 80GB, and we review a new media player, the Cowon Q5W.
item.itunes:keywords: iPod Zune Cowon OLPC XO Asus Eee Zonbu Wired
item.description: In this episode, we discuss Sega's plans to make mind-controlled toys using technology from NeuroSky. Wired helps you decide whether you should buy the iPod Classic or the Microsoft Zune 80GB, and we review a new media player, the Cowon Q5W.

item.title: Wired Gadget Lab Podcast #008
item.itunes:author: Dylan Tweney
item.itunes:summary: This week on the Gadget Lab podcast, we discuss the MediaGate MG-350HD, an appliance for streaming HD video content around your house; the Blue Sky EXO desktop computer speakers; and a raging dispute between film photography fans and digital camera buffs.
item.description: This week on the Gadget Lab podcast, we discuss the MediaGate MG-350HD, an appliance for streaming HD video content around your house; the Blue Sky EXO desktop computer speakers; and a raging dispute between film photography fans and digital camera buffs.

item.title: Wired Gadget Lab Podcast #007
item.itunes:author: Dylan Tweney
item.itunes:summary: In this week's episode, we discuss exploding cell phone batteries, high-tech snowboards, Canon's hard-drive based high-def camcorder, the HG10, and the Blu-Ray vs HD-DVD debate. Plus, the winner of our Halo 3 supergeek contest!
item.itunes:keywords: Canon HG10 Blu-Ray HD-DVD exploding cellphone battery Halo 3
item.description: In this week's episode, we discuss exploding cell phone batteries, high-tech snowboards, Canon's hard-drive based high-def camcorder, the HG10, and the Blu-Ray vs HD-DVD debate. Plus, the winner of our Halo 3 supergeek contest!

item.title: Wired's Gadget Lab Podcast #006
item.itunes:author: Dylan Tweney
item.itunes:summary: In this week's podcast from Wired's Gadget Lab, we talk about the launch of Microsoft's second-generation MP3 player, the Zune 2. Our reviewer's verdict? Not bad, and much better than the previous version. Plus, we review the Canon EOS 40D, a digital SLR camera, and talk about Warner Music's amazing about-face on Apple's ITunes: They actually like it!
item.itunes:keywords: microsoft apple itunes iphone zune canon 40d slr dslr digital camera warner
item.description: In this week's podcast from Wired's Gadget Lab, we talk about the launch of Microsoft's second-generation MP3 player, the Zune 2. Our reviewer's verdict? Not bad, and much better than the previous version. Plus, we review the Canon EOS 40D, a digital SLR camera, and talk about Warner Music's amazing about-face on Apple's ITunes: They actually like it!

item.title: Wired's Gadget Lab Podcast #005
item.itunes:summary: In episode #005 of the Gadget Lab Podcast, we talk about this week's hottest gadget news: the GooglePhone that never was -- aka the Open Handset Alliance's new smartphone operating system, Android; the iPhone launch in the U.K. and the associated release of firmware version 1.1.2; and Wired's review of the Panasonic HFC-SD5, a completely solid-state high-definition camcorder that blew us away.
item.itunes:keywords: Google iPhone Android Panasonic
item.description: In episode #005 of the Gadget Lab Podcast, we talk about this week's hottest gadget news: the GooglePhone that never was -- aka the Open Handset Alliance's new smartphone operating system, Android; the iPhone launch in the U.K. and the associated release of firmware version 1.1.2; and Wired's review of the Panasonic HFC-SD5, a completely solid-state high-definition camcorder that blew us away.

item.title: Gadget Lab Podcast 004
item.itunes:author: Wired News
item.itunes:summary: In episode 4 of the Wired Gadget Lab Podcast, we discuss the brand-new Sidekick LX, an SD card adapter that lets your camera connect to a Wi-Fi network, a $99 HD-DVD player at Wal-Mart, and the $300 Asus eeePC. Plus: NBC executives go crazy on Apple's iPod!
item.itunes:keywords: Sidekick T-Mobile eyeFi eeePC Asus HD-DVD Wal-Mart NBC Apple iPod
item.description: In episode 4 of the Wired Gadget Lab Podcast, we discuss the brand-new Sidekick LX, an SD card adapter that lets your camera connect to a Wi-Fi network, a $99 HD-DVD player at Wal-Mart, and the $300 Asus eeePC. Plus: NBC executives go crazy on Apple's iPod!

item.title: Wired Gadget Lab Podcast 003
item.itunes:author: Wired
item.itunes:summary: Episode 3 of the Gadget Lab podcast talks about the latest gadgets reviewed by the editors of WIRED, plus CTIA, the release of Mac OS X Leopard, and the Fall Test issue of WIRED.
item.itunes:keywords: Wired CTIA Mac OSX Leopard Tablet PC Blu-Ray Hitachi Gateway Fujitsu

item.title: WIRED's Gadget Lab Podcast #1: New Zunes, Gateway One, and the RIAA
item.itunes:author: Dylan Tweney
item.itunes:summary: In episode #1 of WIRED's Gadget Lab podcast, we talk about Microsoft's just-launched second-generation Zune MP3 player (verdict: not as crummy as the first go round), the RIAA's $222,000 judgement against a file-sharing mom, Gateway's new all-in-one PC, and a killer gaming monitor, also from Gateway.
item.itunes:keywords: gadgets hardware products computers gateway apple microsoft zune
item.description: In episode #1 of WIRED's Gadget Lab podcast, we talk about Microsoft's just-launched second-generation Zune MP3 player (verdict: not as crummy as the first go round), the RIAA's $222,000 judgement against a file-sharing mom, Gateway's new all-in-one PC, and a killer gaming monitor, also from Gateway.
